Context:
* George Brown College students, faculty, and staff can use the Inter-Library Loan (ILL) service to request items from other Ontario College Libraries.
* This service is not available to alumni or external borrowers.
* Items that can be requested include books, DVDs, videos, and articles.
* The process takes time, with items taking at least two weeks to arrive.
* To submit a request, fill out the appropriate form with required information or obtain it from the Library Reference Desk or email illo@georgebrown.ca.
* Students, staff, and faculty can borrow available items from any other Ontario Community College library using their George Brown library card.
* Borrowing is subject to the terms of the library that holds the item.
* Students are required to return materials directly to the library where they signed them out.
* Contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
* Social Media Hub is available for visitors to check.
* Information contained in the website is subject to change without notice and should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty.
* Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
